title: Squared CL

nouns: A toxic, green, gaseous chemical element (symbol Cl) with an atomic number of 17.
A very reactive and highly toxic green, gaseous element, belonging to the halogen family of substances with symbol Cl and atomic number 17.
Chlorine is a chemical element with symbol Cl and atomic number 17.

A common nonmetallic element belonging to the halogens; best known as a heavy yellow irritating toxic gas; used to purify water and as a bleaching agent and disinfectant; occurs naturally only as a salt (as in sea water)
Element with the atomic number of 17

description: CL is what shows on the CLear button of some older mobile phones.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's 'CL' button emoji features a crisp, clean design with a distinctively rounded, almost pill-shaped form. The button itself boasts a subtle glossy sheen and a slight 3D bevel, giving it a tactile and modern feel characteristic of Apple's interface elements. On Apple devices, this emoji clearly signifies a 'Control' or 'Command' key, often used in technical discussions or when referring to keyboard shortcuts.
